name: Terrace by the Sea

reviews.text: I just came back from four nights in Ogunquit where I stayed at Terrace by the Sea. I was a lone traveller so I stayed in room 100 - it is a smaller room right next to the lobby in the main Inn. It was perfect. Small but perfect for me, very clean (and housekeeping came every day to leave it spotless again), and though I was told it didnt have an ocean view, there is!! A partial one but nonetheless! The morning breakfast on the porch was the best way to start my days - good selection of fresh fruit and breads, yogurt, coffee and juice, and the view right on the ocean, just perfect! In the late afternoon before heading out for dinner, it was great to be able to have a drink on one of the patio chairs on the beautiful manicured lawn looking at the ocean. The location of the place could not be better...A walk to so many restaurants, shops, even Perkins Cove, and the beach is literally three minutes away. I didnt use the pool much (just once when the beach got extremely windy) but it was clean. I have been going to Ogunquit for over 30 years but this was first time staying directly on the coean...well, needless to say, I can never do it any other way from now on!! The only tiny little thing, and this is restricted to my specific room (100) is that in the morning you do hear the "clings" from the plates and cutlery form the staff setting the breakfast, but honestly, it wasnt that loud, and I had brought some ear plugs so it was an easy fix ;) I would definitely recommend this place!
reviews.title: Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 4 beautiful days in this comfortable and welcoming B&B. The main house was so quaint.A beautiful wrap around porch with tables set for morning breakfast while you enjoy the beautiful view of the ocean in front of you. A relaxing lawn where you can sit out in lawn chairs provided, to watch the ocean while you enjoy a glass of wine as the sun going down. Anything you need is there. Very accommodating, beach towels, small heated pool ,even umbrellas on the front porch if it rains. Rooms are comfy and very clean! No need to take your car to the beach or to town. Its a short walk to everywhere.Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Nothing left out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been going to Terrace since 1993. Even when it's changed ownership, we've received the best of service and enjoyed the best view. There are now new properties added that enhance the ease of accessing the beach and Main Street. The breakfast that is included is a wonderful Continental breakfast, plus cereals and fruit, very satisfying and the best of bagels, etc. We stay in one of the efficiencies with a direct beach/ocean view and outside porch. Reservations are a MUST for those few units, but there are possible vacancies otherwise on the property. When you call, make your preference known and they'll do their best to accommodate.
reviews.title: Glorious - AGAIN!

reviews.text: We are very satisfied with this hotel. It was in the perfect location for us . Very short walk to the beach and town. The view from our room was gorgeous and the room was huge. All of the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location, great view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was the mattress was not firm enough for me and felt like it needed to be replaced. The sheets were very worn and had those little balls that happen with age on sheets with low thread counts.
reviews.title: A perfect place in a perfect town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this place. We stayed at a chain motel in York the night before and just were not ready to go home so we looked around Ogunquit. We were treated with utmost respect although we had just walked in to inquire about rooms and pricing. We selected a room that was less expensive - no ocean view and not in the main building. We still loved it! It was the most spacious and best outfitted 'motel-style' room I've ever stayed in. They have a parking lot with your own assigned space so there's no bumping you out of your spot. You can walk to restaurants, bars, and the beach. The only drawback is minor in that although the ocean is right in front of the inn it's a bit of a walk to actually get to the beach. On the plus side both the calmer river as well as the ocean are right there. The main house looks and feels like a lovely b&b with antiques in the living room and coffee and tea available all day. The breakfast is a more than sufficient continental breakfast. I almost hate to be writing this review as we hope to stay again and want 'our' room to be available!
reviews.title: Best find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After visiting Ogunquit for the first time we came back two weeks later and decided to stay in a different place. We definitely don't regret choosing Terrace. The location is perfect. We stayed in the main building and our ocean view room was spotless, comfortable and fresh. The only complaint we may have is the fact that our bathroom was a little too small (no bath tub just a shower). Breakfast was basic but almost everything tastes great when you eat you meal during sunny morning on an ocean-view porch with a cooling breeze. The whole facility is well maintained and organized and staff is very nice and friendly. Prices are reasonable especially if you consider one of the best locations in town. We're coming back there.
reviews.title: Location is perfect.

reviews.text: We had our annual girls weekend here and we will be back! We had an amazing room with a great view. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Totally professional yet laid-back. Very nice breakfast and coffee every morning on the front porch overlooking the ocean. This place is absolutely beautiful. Feels more like a community than a stuffy hotel. We really enjoyed the proximity to town as well. No driving! We have stayed a lot of places over the years but this was by far the best! Thanks Terrace by the Sea! We will be back!
reviews.title: Great hotel! Amazing view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the motel building( the old Kings Court) and were amazed when we walked into the room. We were in an upstairs room and loved the cathedral ceilings and the brightness. It was like a new building. It was wonderful to be able to open the 3 available windows for the fresh air. The breakfast was just what we like--cereal, fruit, juice, coffee and english muffins and muffins. The breakfast setting was lovely--each table had a small vase with a fresh rose and overlooked the river and beach, classical music was playing and everything was immaculate. It was a close walk to town and also to the beach.It seemed to be a very quiet place. It is our new favorite in Ogunquit.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: My family and I stayed for 2 nights in June. As before, the room was neat and clean and everything was great. This time we stayed in the first floor of the suite building. Nice and quiet drizzly Monday and Tuesday. Breakfast was simple and good. We love eating on the deck with the great ocean views. Service was excellent. The combination of location, price and service make this a great Ogunquit option. We will return again.
reviews.title: Another Good Visit

reviews.text: It was the worst place I ever seen in all my years of traveling. They said the place was renovated. No signs if that My friends called it the Bates Motel after the movie Pyscho. Location is excellent but there are so much nicer places to stay in the area. T next door is the Anchorage. So much nicer. Terrace By the Sea is old and rundown
reviews.title: Bates Motel (pyscho) is nicer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited May 10-13 and everything was wonderful ! The lawn was green, well-cut, the rooms were clean, the breakfast buffet was great, and, on Mother's Day,Sergio personally gave each woman a fresh-cut rose. We'll be back at least 2 more times this year.
reviews.title: Excellent ! Again!

reviews.text: I was looking for a little hotel I could run away to for 1 night with a nice view. boy did I score. It was simple and perfect for my little get away. My room had a little kitchen- which I only used the fridge of but having it deeply induced my desire to stay longer. Being off season but on a weekend- it was not very private- but I didn't need private. The boardwalk to the beach was directly below my room and we nodded and smiled and shared a few hellos with those walking below the deck. I could see the sunrise from my bed- I turned around and put my head where my feet were suppose to be and watched the sunrise over the ocean. The walls were paper thin - and me being a light sleeper- well If it was summer time - you might wanna bring along some ear plugs as we could hear the man snoring in the room next to us (or was it two rooms over). I'm guessing he was pretty loud though.. we were laughing a lot (my friend and I sharing some stories from our childhood) so no complaints on his snoring from me-laugh. Anyway, the bathroom was on the small side but the bath soaps were wonderful. I wish we had booked 2 nights instead of 1. It's perfect for walking into town. My room was perfect for the view. Wish again I had more time and a book with me. It was super close to the beach. Everything was just as I had hoped it would be. Breakfast was bagels, juice, coffee some fruit. Your continental- simple but enough. I think during peak season if you are looking for something "romantic" and a bit removed- this might be to close to the action of a spot for you but if you are with your kids, a friend or family member this was a perfect location. They did have rooms that were not on top of the boardwalk area but if you don't mind people and you are the social type- this was perfect.
reviews.title: ocean view room

reviews.text: I can never get up to Terrace by the Sea enough times!! I stay there 5 or 6 times per season from Memorial Day Wekend through Columbus Day Weekend. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the grounds are always well maintained. The breakfast is terrific and the staff is always friendly and helpful! I always have a wonderful time and I can't wait for my next trip!!
reviews.title: Always love staying at Terrace by the Sea!!

reviews.text: Our second time at this motel. This time, we stayed (only one night) in a second floor room in the Inn building. Our bedroom was very nice. Quite spacious, clean and comfortable. We had a partial view of the shore, which was very nice. The free continental breakfast was adequate. Fresh bagels and other breads, fruits, cereals, but nothing extra special. There is a nice area overlooking the town beach, with plenty of lounge chairs in which to relax. Proximity to the beach, the Marginal Way and the Ogunquit shops could not be much better. The proprieters/service folks were very pleasant and helpful. The price was certainly in line with other inns/motels in the area. As with most facilities, we recommend staying in a second floor (top floor) room, to avoid being disturbed from an above room. We stayed in the room below this one during our first trip, and heard footsteps above late into the night. That said, we would still return to the Terrace by the Sea.
reviews.title: Looking forward to next visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend 27-29 July. The location is amazing! Private parking, right in town, 5 min walk to the beach and 5 min walk to the entrance of Marginal Way. We stayed in a 2nd floor motel unit with great ocean views. The room was much larger than I expected. It included cathedral ceilings and a 2nd floor loft. Our room was very clean but could have used some updating. The age of the room had no impact on our great experience. The inclusive continental breakfast was a perfect start to the day. We took a short 2 mile drive to Frankie & Johnny's in York for the best dinner ever! The setting is very unpretentious, small and quirky. If you are looking for a break from trendy ambiance and don't mind BYOB... this is a must! We went to the Piano bar Sat night and it was a great time! We are looking forward to another great stay! We may consider bringing our 2 and 6yr old boys because they would also have a blast!
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on Saturday & Sunday. We had a spectacular corner room in the redone motel unit. It had a large king size bed, and four windows, which all had screens. We never find that in many places we have stayed. The room was ready early, when we arrived. It is a spotless property, that has a wonderful staff. They have a beautiful pool, and the room comes with a continental breakfast. You have the beauty of the location of this hotel. It faces the river and ocean, and they have very comfortable chairs and lounges, for all to enjoy. We had perfect weather. We ate the at the Front Porch upstairs, and love the piano music and singers. On Sunday we dined at 98 Provence. The restaurant was spectacular and ended our wonderful two night getaway. This property is truly a hidden gem.
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend
They do everything right
reviews.text: The first thing Terrace by the Sea got right was location. Just down a side street from the center of bustling Ogunquit TBTS sits on a peaceful knoll overlooking both the mouth of the Ogunquit River and Ogunquit Beach. You can enjoy the view and the sun from the lawn chairs without going to the beach. But if you want to go you are right along the footpath toward the bridge and beach. Second thing right is free wifi- too many places charge for an amenity that is essentially costless to the proprietor. Then there's a simple but nice breakfast included in the room cost: fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, toast and coffee (all day). New York Times, complementary, means you can read the paper over breakfast on the outdoor porch which, like the lawn, overlooks both river and beach. We think the rooms are best in the inn building but there are several adjacent motel buildings which the owners have acquired over time and which are adequate. TBTS is not fancy but rather it feels homey. And if you want to practice your French there are lots of French-Canadian guests: les Quebecois aussi aiment cette lieu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 10 days at the Terrace over 4th of July week. Our first two nites were in the main inn. The room looked right out to the ocean...it was awesome! The room was clean and blessedly cool when we checked it...it was 95 degrees when we checked in. When we left the next day to go to the beach, we'd shut off the air conditioner, but soon realized as we were getting off the beach because it was to hot, we made a quick phone call to the front desk to ask if they'd turn it on before we got back. Erin was so helpful and nice about doing so, it was one more check mark in the plus column for us! For the rest of our stay, we were in the building that is on the footpath. They have a small kitchenette, and the view is to die for!! We had our breakfast out on the porch every day...it was WONDERFUL!! The staff ( with a shout out to Erin!!) is friendly and so super accomodating, that as we checked out, we reserved for next year!! We're also going back for Labor Day weekend! If you're looking for a clean and friendly place to stay....the Terrace is TOPS!!!
reviews.title: BEST PLACE EVER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here a few times with my mother and sisters in the last few years in spring time and really liked it. Just came back from an overnight with my husband and summer at Terrace by the Sea is just terrific. Great staff, fab location, nice rooms....all good. We were assigned to a "partial ocean view" that was quite nice...certainly more than expected! Very peaceful without being staid.
reviews.title: Such a sweet place to stay

aka: Terrace By The Sea Hotel Ogunquit
description: Located just a walk away from Ogunquit's beautiful beach, fine dining and shopping, the Terrace By The Sea is a perfect location to fully enjoy the heart of Ogunquit and what our town has to offer. Three buildings offering gorgeous oceanfront rooms, an extended continental breakfast, complimentary high-speed internet, heated pool, and much more. Come enjoy oceanfront accommodations from our point of view.
